Tunable.name: churn_alarm_interval

TunableList.name: fan_count_by_fame_level

Tunable.name: fan_situation_interval
Tunable.description: The amount of time, in Sim minutes, between attempts to create new fan/stan situations.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A literal value that is to be used as the lower and upper bound of an interval. This allows both literal and range interval tunings in the same TunableVariant without having to manually set the lower and upper bounds to the same value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The upper and lower bounds.

TunableTuple.name: random_in_range
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: disable_churn
Tunable.description: If checked, we disable churn for this shift change. That means we only fire the situation on shift change, not in between shifts. So if you have a situation in this shift and it ends, we don't spin up another one on the next churn (based on churn interval). Basically means you want a one shot situation, fire and forget. If unchecked, we will try to maintain the desired number of situations at every churn interval during this shift change.

TunableList.name: weighted_situations
TunableList.description: A weighted list of situations to be used while fulfilling the desired Sim count.

TunableTuple.description: Situation creation parameters.

TunableTuple.description: The first value is the day of the week that maps to a desired curve of population by time of the day. days_of_the_week population_desire_by_time_of_day M,Th,F time_curve_1 W,Sa time_curve_2 By production/design request we do not support multiple population curves for the same day. e.g. if you want something special to occur at noon on a Wednesday, make a unique curve for Wednesday and apply the changes to it.

TunableTuple.name: days_of_the_week
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

TunableList.name: walkby_desire_by_time_of_day
TunableList.display: Walkby Desire By Time Of Day
TunableList.description: Each entry in the map has two columns. The first column is the hour of the day (0-24) that maps to a desired list of population (second column). The entry with starting hour that is closest to, but before the current hour will be chosen. Given this tuning: hour_of_day desired_situations 6 [(w1, s1), (w2, s2)] 10 [(w1, s2)] 14 [(w2, s5)] 20 [(w9, s0)] if the current hour is 11, hour_of_day will be 10 and desired is [(w1, s2)]. if the current hour is 19, hour_of_day will be 14 and desired is [(w2, s5)]. if the current hour is 23, hour_of_day will be 20 and desired is [(w9, s0)]. if the current hour is 2, hour_of_day will be 20 and desired is [(w9, s0)]. (uses 20 tuning because it is not 6 yet) The entries will be automatically sorted by time.

Tunable.name: stan_situation
Tunable.description: Stan situation. A stan situation is tied to a particular Sim via a relationship bit defined in FanTuning.

TunableList.name: object_based_situations_schedule
TunableList.description: DEPRECATED: Use Object Situation Shifts instead! If Object Situation Shifts are enabled, this schedule is IGNORED! A zone-director based schedule with an object tag. This schedule is matched to a specific object tag. > If the tagged object doesn't exist on the lot, this schedule is ignored. > If the tagged object exists on the zone lot and has its own Situations Scheduler Component AND 'Use Object Provided Situation Schedule' is checked, and the component's Tests do not evaluate to False, this schedule is ignored. > If the tagged object exists on the zone lot, and either does not have its own Situations Scheduler Component OR 'Use Object Provided Situation Schedule' is NOT checked, this schedule is used to spawn situations.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: An object tag. If the object exist on the zone lot, situations will be scheduled.

TunableTuple.description: Data associated with situations schedule.

Tunable.description: If True, consider all objects in lot and the open street for this object situation. If False, only consider objects on the active lot.

Tunable.name: schedule_immediate
Tunable.description: This controls the behavior of scheduler if the current time happens to fall within a schedule entry. If this is True, a start_callback will trigger immediately for that entry. If False, the next start_callback will occur on the next entry.

TunableVariant.name: object_situation_shifts
TunableVariant.description: Enables modern object situation shifts, and ignores deprecated Object Based Situation Schedule. This is a zone-director-based schedule for situations associated with an object tag. The situations specified in this schedule will occur IF: - The tagged object exists in the area (lot or open street), AND - one of the following is true: > 'Use Object Situation Scheduler Component' is unchecked > the object does not have its own Situations Scheduler Component, > The object's Situations Scheduler Component does not have its own Object Situation Shifts (Object Based Situation Schedules are deprecated) > In the object's Situations Scheduler Component, 'Tests' evaluates to False

TunableList.name: object_situations
TunableList.description: This is a zone-director-based schedule for situations associated with an object tag. The situations specified in this schedule will occur IF: - The tagged object exists in the area (lot or open street), AND - one of the following is true: > 'Use Object Situation Scheduler Component' is unchecked > the object does not have its own Situations Scheduler Component, > The object's Situations Scheduler Component does not have its own Object Situation Shifts (Object Based Situation Schedules are deprecated) > In the object's Situations Scheduler Component, 'Tests' evaluates to False

Tunable.name: consider_off_lot_objects
Tunable.description: If checked, these situations are scheduled for all instances of the object in both the active lot and the open street. If unchecked, these situations are only scheduled for objects within the active lot.

TunableVariant.name: include_objects_within_object_inventories
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, provide one or more Container Object Tags (e.g. func_Crypt). Objects with any of the Container Object Tags will allow the zone director to include the container object's inventory in its search for objects that can start situations. Staffed Object Situations based on inventoried objects will have the spawned sims walk up to the container object instead.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A list of Container Object Tags.

TunableEnum.description: An object tag. If an object has this tag, and it has an inventory, the zone director can schedule object situations based on objects INSIDE this object's inventory. Staffed Object Situations based on inventoried objects will have the spawned sims walk up to the container object instead.

Tunable.name: schedule_immediate
Tunable.description: This controls the behavior of the scheduler if the current time happens to fall within a scheduled entry. If this is True, start_missed_situations will trigger immediately for that entry. If False, the shift will start at its next scheduled entry.

TunableVariant.name: set_host_as
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will set a host sim (aka Requesting Sim) for the situations being started. The host sim can influence the default guest list for the situation, if we do not have a premade guest list. Most of the time this should be the Active Sim. In the case of Object Situation Shifts only, select SimFromObject if you want to set the host sim as the sim stored on the object (e.g. the ghost associated with an urnstone).

Tunable.name: set_host_as_active_sim
Tunable.description: DEPRECATED-- use Set Host As instead. If Set Host As is enabled, it will OVERRIDE this setting. If checked then the active Sim will be set as the host of situations started from this director if we do not have a pre-made guest list.

Tunable.name: disable_churn
Tunable.description: If checked, we disable churn for this shift change. That means we only fire the situation on shift change, not in between shifts. So if you have a situation in this shift and it ends, we don't spin up another one on the next churn (based on churn interval). Basically means you want a one shot situation, fire and forget. If unchecked, we will try to maintain the desired number of situations at every churn interval during this shift change.

TunableEnum.name: shift_strictness
TunableEnum.description: Determine how situations on shift will be handled on shift change. Example: I want 3 customers between 10-12. then after 12 I want only 1. Having this checked will allow 3 customers to stay and will let situation duration kick the sim out when appropriate. This will not create new situations if over the cap.

TunableVariant.name: set_host_as
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will set a host sim (aka Requesting Sim) for the situations being started. The host sim can influence the default guest list for the situation, if we do not have a premade guest list. Most of the time this should be the Active Sim. In the case of Object Situation Shifts only, select SimFromObject if you want to set the host sim as the sim stored on the object (e.g. the ghost associated with an urnstone).

Tunable.name: set_host_as_active_sim
Tunable.description: DEPRECATED-- use Set Host As instead. If Set Host As is enabled, it will OVERRIDE this setting. If checked then the active Sim will be set as the host of situations started from this director if we do not have a pre-made guest list.

TunableList.name: entries
TunableList.description: A list of tuples declaring a relationship between days of the week and desire curves.

TunableTuple.description: The first value is the day of the week that maps to a desired curve of population by time of the day. days_of_the_week population_desire_by_time_of_day M,Th,F time_curve_1 W,Sa time_curve_2 By production/design request we do not support multiple population curves for the same day. e.g. if you want something special to occur at noon on a Wednesday, make a unique curve for Wednesday and apply the changes to it.

TunableTuple.name: days_of_the_week
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

TunableList.name: walkby_desire_by_time_of_day
TunableList.display: Walkby Desire By Time Of Day
TunableList.description: Each entry in the map has two columns. The first column is the hour of the day (0-24) that maps to a desired list of population (second column). The entry with starting hour that is closest to, but before the current hour will be chosen. Given this tuning: hour_of_day desired_situations 6 [(w1, s1), (w2, s2)] 10 [(w1, s2)] 14 [(w2, s5)] 20 [(w9, s0)] if the current hour is 11, hour_of_day will be 10 and desired is [(w1, s2)]. if the current hour is 19, hour_of_day will be 14 and desired is [(w2, s5)]. if the current hour is 23, hour_of_day will be 20 and desired is [(w9, s0)]. if the current hour is 2, hour_of_day will be 20 and desired is [(w9, s0)]. (uses 20 tuning because it is not 6 yet) The entries will be automatically sorted by time.

Tunable.name: yoga_instructor_idle_situation
Tunable.description: The idle situation to find an NPC yoga instructor to lead a scheduled yoga class. A scheduled class cannot start unless there is a free idle instructor in the zone. The situation tuned here is normally scheduled in the zone director's situation shifts.
